The Battle of Hastings, fought on October 14, 1066, signified the ultimate victory of William the Conqueror. This clash happened near Hastings in modern-day England and brought about the beginning of the Norman rule in Britain. After this triumph, William was crowned King of England and ruled until his death in 1087.
